result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Nelessen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Sentence credit of 3 days were 
granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA Assessment and follow through. No Contact with the victim. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. To include any domestic violence counseling. 
*May terminate probation after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent. 
*  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
from Ryan Schraufnagel dated 6/4/16

Defendant Joseph M Nelessen in court with Attorney Matthew Huppertz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

45 DAYS HUBER   (CREDIT - 3 days, if revoked)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    *May terminate after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent (to include any DV counseling)
____No contact with: victim

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
Received today, from Atty Huppertz to Judge Carter, with information for 06/06/16 sentencing hearing.
Sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joseph M Nelessen in court with Attorney Matthew Huppertz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #3.  Counts #1 & 2 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Huppertz requests an adjourned date for sentencing.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
